page.title: 02Manor Farm, Aust
page.content: Brian Gee is the farmer who lives on site at Manor Farm. He is in charge of milking the eighty-five Fresian cows. This milk is then supplied to Cliffords Dairy in Thornbury. The farm has no crops growing apart from grass and occupies ninety-two acres. Only two people are employed to work the farm. The present farmer has been on the farm for six years, but it is not family run. It was built in the seventeenth century but since then new buildings have been erected so the old ones are no longer used. Although cows are kept pigs are housed on a different farm a few miles away. To keep animals away from going too close to the fence it is electrified. Brian said the thing he likes about farming is being in the open.
